title: Nashville teen charged in shooting death of friend
content:
NASHVILLE, TN (WSMV) -
A teen is now charged in the shooting death of his friend.
Metro police have charged 18-year-old James Nicholas Jones with reckless homicide.
Officers said he admitted to shooting his friend Luan Le on Christmas Eve.
According to police, Jones claims he was handling a pistol at Le's west Nashville home when the gun went off, killing the 16-year-old.
Jones is already charged with aggravated burglary in connection to a break-in at a home on Comet Drive on Dec. 17. Those stolen items were reportedly found at Le's home on Wilclay Drive.
